title: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine: James McHenry
body: James McHenry         James McHenry   A soldier, physician, and politician who was one ot several foreign-born signers of the Constitution, McHenry served as a surgeon and as an aide to Washington and Lafayette during the War for Independence; sat in the Maryland legislature and the Continental Congress; and held the position of Secretary of War in the Washington and John Adams administrations. Baltimore's Fort McHenry was named after him. For more information: James McHenry, Soldier-Statesman
